alert.note: Alert for Iron (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 2:44PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dry wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Utah, including the following county, Iron. * WHEN...Until 445 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. UDOT has reported mud and debris over SR143. Be prepared for road closures in this area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing dry wash and small stream flooding. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... SR-143 between Brian Head and Parowan, Parowan Creek and Benson Creek.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
